bug.author: 13564545AWq
bug.summary: Hello guys , does any one know how to solve this issue ? Thanks in advance!
bug.description:
Please make sure that this is a bug. As per our GitHub Policy, we only address code/doc bugs, performance issues, feature requests and build/installation issues on GitHub. tag:bug_template System information
Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in TensorFlow): OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04): Mobile device (e.g. iPhone 8, Pixel 2, Samsung Galaxy) if the issue happens on mobile device: TensorFlow installed from (source or binary): TensorFlow version (use command below): Python version: Bazel version (if compiling from source): GCC/Compiler version (if compiling from source): CUDA/cuDNN version: GPU model and memory:
You can collect some of this information using our environment capture <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tools/tf_env_collect.sh>script</denchmark-link>
You can also obtain the TensorFlow version with:
TF 1.0: python -c "import tensorflow as tf; print(tf.GIT_VERSION, tf.VERSION)" TF 2.0: python -c "import tensorflow as tf; print(tf.version.GIT_VERSION, tf.version.VERSION)"
Describe the current behavior Describe the expected behavior Standalone code to reproduce the issue Provide a reproducible test case that is the bare minimum necessary to generate the problem. If possible, please share a link to Colab/Jupyter/any notebook. Other info / logs Include any logs or source code that would be helpful to diagnose the problem. If including tracebacks, please include the full traceback. Large logs and files should be attached.

comments.comment:
My code is here üëç #!sur/bin/python3 <denchmark-h:h1>--coding:utf-8 --</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h1>Author: Wang Quan</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h1>@time:2021/1/2 7:46</denchmark-h>
import tensorflow as tf import matplotlib.pyplot as plt from tensorflow import keras <denchmark-h:h1>from tensorflow.keras.models import Sequential</denchmark-h>
import numpy as np import math (x_train,y_train),(x_test,y_test)=keras.datasets.mnist.load_data() <denchmark-h:h1>print(len(x_train))</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h1>print(len(x_test))</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h1>print(x_train[0].shape)</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h1>plt.matshow(x_train[0])</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h1>plt.show()</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h1>print(y_train[0])</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h1>print(x_train.shape)</denchmark-h>
x_train=x_train/255.0 x_test=x_test/255.0 x_train_flattened= x_train.reshape(len(x_train),2828) x_test_flattened= x_test.reshape(len(x_test),2828) <denchmark-h:h1>print(x_train_flattened.shape)</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h1>print(x_test_flattened.shape)</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h1>print(x_train[2])</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h1>print(x_train_flattened[2])</denchmark-h>
model=keras.Sequential([ keras.layers.Dense(10,input_shape=(784,),activation='sigmoid') ]) model.compile(optimizer='adam', loss='sparse_categorical_crossentropy', metrics=['accuracy']) model.fit(x_train_flattened,y_train,epochs=5) model.evaluate(x_test_flattened,y_test) <denchmark-h:h1>plt.matshow(x_test[2])</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h1>plt.show()</denchmark-h>
y_predict=model.predict(x_test_flattened) print(np.argmax(y_predict[2])) #ÊâìÂç∞7 y_predicted_labels = [np.argmax(i) for i in y_predict] <denchmark-h:h1>print(y_predicted_labels[:5])</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h1># y_test[:5]</denchmark-h>
cm=tf.math.confusion_matrix(labels=y_test,predictions=y_predicted_labels) print(cm) import seaborn as sn plt.figure(figsize=(10,7)) sn.heatmap(cm,annot=True,fmt='d') plt.xlabel('predicted') plt.ylabel('truth') plt.show() I got error :Tensor("confusion_matrix/SparseTensorDenseAdd:0", shape=(10, 10), dtype=int32) Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:/Users/Administrator/Desktop/ÂÖâÂ≠¶Á≥ªÁªü/Keras Code/mnist read.py", line 53, in sn.heatmap(cm,annot=True,fmt='d') File "C:\Users\Administrator\Anaconda3\envs\pythonProject\lib\site-packages\seaborn_decorators.py", line 46, in inner_f return f(**kwargs) File "C:\Users\Administrator\Anaconda3\envs\pythonProject\lib\site-packages\seaborn\matrix.py", line 537, in heatmap yticklabels, mask) File "C:\Users\Administrator\Anaconda3\envs\pythonProject\lib\site-packages\seaborn\matrix.py", line 101, in init plot_data = np.asarray(data) File "C:\Users\Administrator\Anaconda3\envs\pythonProject\lib\site-packages\numpy\core_asarray.py", line 83, in asarray return array(a, dtype, copy=False, order=order) File "C:\Users\Administrator\Anaconda3\envs\pythonProject\lib\site-packages\tensorflow_core\python\framework\ops.py", line 736, in array " array.".format(self.name)) NotImplementedError: Cannot convert a symbolic Tensor (confusion_matrix/SparseTensorDenseAdd:0) to a numpy array.

Please:
Fill in issue template Use proper markdown formatting so code and error are easy to read Give a minimal reproducing example, not a large piece of code Give the issue a relevant title.
